subject: Reusing a generic test but changing the test case name
msgSnippet: .setName( XXXX ) appears to change the test case such that it looks for a testXXXX method which represents the test. I have a legacy test suite for a backend
messageBody:
.setName("XXXX") appears to change the test case such that it looks
for a testXXXX method which represents the test.

I have a legacy test suite for a backend system that runs through a
generic test driver like:
generic_driver testcasename.serviceclass otherargs...

testcasename.serviceclass represents an xml input file that the test
driver knows how to read and pass along to the system.
There is a large existing suite, but we also have a Web frontend
system to access this legacy system. I've already written some
HTTPUnit tests for the new system, but I'd like to have both run as
JUnit tests to take advantage of the great reporting, then tie
things together with ANT.

I'd like to have a single test method, for example testGeneric_driver
() that calls out to the generic_driver. Then it can call the same
method mutliple times only switching the parameters (including the
testcase name.)

Currently, I can get the following results...

Name Status Type Time
testGeneric_driver() success
testGeneric_driver() success
testGeneric_driver() success
testGeneric_driver() success
testGeneric_driver() success


I know all the tests have run, but I'd like to change the name
dynamically...

Name Status Type Time
createCustomer1.rpc success
createCustomer2.rpc success
createCustomer3.rpc success
createOrder1-1.tran success
createOrder1-1.tran success

Within the testcase, is it possible to change the name?

Public void test testGeneric_driver() throws exception {
//change name

// call out to the other test framework

// handle Success, Error, or Failure as appropriate based on
the return code
}


I don't want to create thousands of test methods to call out to the
old system, but I would like to leverage the reporting in the JUnit
framework and leverage JUnit and HTTPUnit for the newer development.

Has anyone run into a similar scenario? Any thoughts on the best
way to change the name dynamically.

Thanks,
Oscar
